definitions.definition: Of or relating to the planet Mars, or its imagined inhabitants.
Pertaining to the astrological influence of the planet Mars; aggressive, bellicose.
Pertaining to battle or war; martial, military.
To endeavour to depress the price of, or prices in.
definitions.example: to bear a railroad stock

definitions.definition: To carry or convey, literally or figuratively.
definitions.example: Judging from the look on his face, he wasn't bearing good news.

definitions.definition: To support, sustain, or endure.
To support, keep up, or maintain.
To press or impinge upon.
To produce, yield, give birth to.
(originally nautical) To be, or head, in a specific direction or azimuth (from somewhere).
definitions.example: By my readings, we're bearing due south, so we should turn about ten degrees east.

definitions.definition: To gain or win.
(in combination) That bears (some specified thing).
definitions.example: a gift-bearing visitor

definitions.definition: Of a beam, column, or other device, carrying weight or load.
definitions.example: That's a bearing wall.

definitions.definition: A mechanical device that supports another part and/or reduces friction.
The horizontal angle between the direction of an object and another object, or between it and that of true north; a heading or direction.
Relevance; a relationship or connection.
definitions.example: That has no bearing on this issue.

definitions.definition: One's posture, demeanor, or manner.
definitions.example: She walks with a confident, self-assured bearing.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) Direction or relative position.
That part of any member of a building which rests upon its supports.
definitions.example: A lintel or beam may have four inches of bearing upon the wall.

definitions.definition: The portion of a support on which anything rests.
The unsupported span.
definitions.example: The beam has twenty feet of bearing between its supports.

definitions.definition: Any single emblem or charge in an escutcheon or coat of arms.
The obligatory prayer that Muslims are called to perform five times a day.
To destroy.
definitions.example: They demolished the old mill and put up four townhouses.

definitions.definition: To defeat or consume utterly (as a theory, belief or opponent).
A thing or a person put in the rear or in the back of something to reinforce, hold, support.
A default arrangement that holds if all else fails.
A wall or fence behind home plate.
A catcher; the position of catcher.
(rounders) The player who stands immediately behind the striking base.
The longstop.
The wicket-keeper.
Something serving to bolster or support a cover story etc.
To serve as backstop for.
To bolster, support.
A book or an encyclopedia of recipes and cookery tips.
(by extension) Any book of strategies.
definitions.example: The Anarchist's Cookbook

definitions.definition: One who sweeps floors or chimneys.
A detector (for mines).
Any of the small, tropical marine perciform fishes of the family Pempheridae, typically with deeply keeled, compressed bodies and large eyes.
A defender who is the last line of defence before the goalkeeper.
A person who sweeps the ice ahead of the rock in play.
A batsman who plays sweep shots.
A fielding position along the boundary; a fielder in this position.
A tree that has fallen over a river with branches extending into the water.
definitions.example: ..tree will be hanging over the water about canoe level (a sweeper).. Basic Essentials Canoe Paddling, 3rd - Page 62

definitions.definition: A carpet sweeper.
(including) A vacuum cleaner.
(including, Cebu) A group of students tasked at cleaning the homeroom after class dismissal.
Any of various species of large, long-necked waterfowl, of genus Cygnus (bird family: Anatidae), most of which have white plumage.
One whose grace etc. suggests a swan.
This bird used as a heraldic charge, sometimes with a crown around its neck (e. g. the arms of Buckinghamshire).
To travel or move about in an aimless, idle, or pretentiously casual way.
To declare (chiefly in first-person present constructions).
A padded or knit covering put on an item to keep it warm, especially a teapot or egg.
A padded or knit covering for any item (often an electronic device such as a laptop computer).
A work of crime fiction in which sex and violence are downplayed or treated humorously, and the crime and detection take place in a small, socially intimate community.
To become snug and comfortable.
To become friendly with.
definitions.example: He spent all day cosying up to the new boss, hoping for a plum assignment.

definitions.definition: Affording comfort and warmth; snug; social
A holder of the most senior active rank in the Royal Air Force, NATO grade OF-9.
A person or animal who competed in a race but did not win.
A loser; a person or thing soon to be forgotten.
A loud cry or uproar.
definitions.example: His appearance was greeted with an outcry of jeering.

definitions.definition: A strong protest.
definitions.example: The proposal was met with a public outcry.

definitions.definition: An auction.
definitions.example: to send goods to an outcry

definitions.definition: To cry out.
To cry louder than.
The quality of being vulgar.
An offensive or obscene act or expression.

A formal process by which a criminal suspect held by one government is handed over to another government for trial or, if the suspect has already been tried and found guilty, to serve his or her sentence.
Lively and animated; full of life and energy.
Long-lived.
Difficult to kill.
An outdoor garden frame that can be used for partitioning a common area.
An outdoor garden frame that can be used to grow vines or other climbing plants.

A kind of graph, used in communication theory and encryption, whose nodes are ordered into vertical slices by time, with each node at each time connected to at least one node at an earlier and at least one node at a later time.
To train or arrange (plants) so that they grow against a trellis.
definitions.example: to trellis vines

definitions.definition: To catch fire and burn.
(by extension) To be completely ruined or devastated.
definitions.example: When the bank refused the credit, all our plans went up in smoke.

definitions.definition: Drawings or words drawn on a surface in a public place, usually made without authorization.
Informal inscriptions, figure drawings, etc., as opposed to official inscriptions.
To mark a surface with such images.
An enclosure for livestock, especially a circular one.
definitions.example: We had a small corral out back where we kept our pet llama.

definitions.definition: An enclosure or area to concentrate a dispersed group.
definitions.example: Please return the shopping carts to the corral.

definitions.definition: A circle of wagons, either for the purpose of trapping livestock, or for defense.
definitions.example: The wagon train formed a corral to protect against Comanche attacks.

definitions.definition: To capture or round up.
definitions.example: Between us, we managed to corral the puppy in the kitchen.

definitions.definition: To place inside of a corral.
definitions.example: After we corralled the last steer, we headed off to the chuck wagon for dinner.

definitions.definition: To make a circle of vehicles, as of wagons so as to form a corral.
definitions.example: The cattle drivers corralled their wagons for the night.

definitions.definition: The southernmost point on celestial bodies other than Earth.
The negative pole of a magnetic dipole that seeks geographic south.
Alternative form of South Pole
Corresponding in character; congruous
Harmonious.
Having a difference divisible by a modulus.
Coinciding exactly when superimposed.
Satisfying a congruence relation.
A perennial flowering plant (of the genus Crocus in the Iridaceae family). Saffron is obtained from the stamens of Crocus sativus.
Any of various similar flowering plants, such as the autumn crocus and prairie crocus.
A deep yellow powder, the oxide of some metal (especially iron), calcined to a red or deep yellow colour.
A fraudulent doctor; a quack.
Burlap.
definitions.example: a crocus bag

definitions.definition: Any of various small two-winged flies, for example, from the family Chironomidae or non-biting midges, the family Chaoboridae or phantom midges, and the family Ceratopogonidae or biting midges, all belonging to the order Diptera
Any bait or lure designed to resemble a midge

A type of vehicle designed to move on the ground under its own stored power and intended to carry a driver, a small number of additional passengers, and a very limited amount of other load. A car or motorcar.
To travel by automobile.
Self-moving; self-propelled.
A female reproductive organ, often paired, that produces ova and in mammals secretes the hormones estrogen and progesterone.
definitions.example: The male testicles are homologous to the female ovaries.

definitions.definition: The lower part of a pistil or carpel that bears ovules and ripens into fruit.
Initialism of adenylyl cyclase.
Initialism of adjuvant chemotherapy.
Initialism of air corps.
Initialism of army corps.
Initialism of athletic club.
Initialism of audible chuckle.
Initialism of author's correction.
Initialism of automobile club.
Initialism of Auxiliary Collier, (a naval coal transport that travels with the fleet to provide coal for coal powered warships)
Companion of the Order of Australia.
Initialism of aviation cadet.
Initialism of autonomous county.
The maximum altitude above sea level that an aircraft or missile can maintain horizontal flight under normal conditions.
Account; money of account
Alicyclic
Ante cibum, before meals
The practice of restricting entrance to a property, a building, or a room to authorized persons.
In technology, permitting or denying the use of a particular resource.
A regularly updated record of transactions between two parties showing what is owed or due to each party or a statement summarising the position
An English unit of land area (symbol: a. or ac.) originally denoting a day's plowing for a yoke of oxen, now standardized as 4,840 square yards or 4,046.86 square meters.
Any of various similar units of area in other systems.
(usually in the plural) A wide expanse.
definitions.example: I like my new house - there’s acres of space!

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) A large quantity.
A field.
The acre's breadth by the length, English units of length equal to the statute dimensions of the acre: 22 yds (≈20 m) by 220 yds (≈200 m).
A duel fought between individual Scots and Englishmen in the borderlands.
A category of music including soft rock, ballads, easy listening, soul, and rhythm and blues.
The state of temperature and humidity produced by an air conditioner.
An air conditioner or system of air conditioners.
definitions.example: This car has air conditioning.

definitions.definition: A member of the lowest rank in the Royal Air Force or the air forces of various other Commonwealth countries.
An electric current in which the direction of flow of the electrons reverses periodically, such as sawtooth, sinusoidal or square wave current.

An electric current in which the direction of flow of the electrons reverses periodically by a sinusoidal law, hence having an average of zero, with positive and negative values (with a frequency of 50 Hz in Europe, 60 Hz in the US, 400 Hz for airport lighting, and some others); especially such a current produced by a rotating generator or alternator.
A water-soluble salt of ammonia and hydrochloric acid, having the formula NH4Cl.
A space inside the eye between the cornea and the iris, filled with aqueous humour.
A prefix appended to a telephone number indicating the geographical area.

One of the axioms of set theory, equivalent to the statement that an arbitrary direct product of non-empty sets is non-empty; any version of said axiom, for example specifying the cardinality of the number of sets from which choices are made.
definitions.example: The axiom of choice is logically equivalent to the assertion that every vector space has a basis.

definitions.definition: The melting of ice, snow, or other congealed matter; the resolution of ice, or the like, into the state of a fluid; liquefaction by heat of anything congealed by frost
A warmth of weather sufficient to melt that which is frozen
To gradually melt, dissolve, or become fluid; to soften from frozen
definitions.example: the ice thaws

definitions.definition: To become so warm as to melt ice and snow — said in reference to the weather, and used impersonally.
definitions.example: It's beginning to thaw.

definitions.definition: To grow gentle or genial.
definitions.example: Her anger has thawed.

definitions.definition: To gradually cause frozen things (such as earth, snow, ice) to melt, soften, or dissolve.
A defined, narrow section of land or an artificial structure used for access.
The usual path taken by deer or other wild animals, such as from a forest to a water source.
A narrow walkway (often on a platform) extending from a stage on which people walk, especially one used by models during fashion shows.
In javelin, long jump, and similar events: a short track along which athletes can accelerate themselves for their jumps or throws.
A section of land, usually paved, for airplanes to land on or take off from.
Hence, the number of months that a startup company can operate on its cash reserves.
A stream bed.
A section of a ticket, showing the holder to be entitled to some specified accommodation or service, as to a passage over a designated line of travel, a particular seat in a theater, a discount, etc.
A voucher issued by a manufacturer or retailer which offers a discount on a particular product.

A certificate of interest due, printed at the bottom of transferable bonds (state, railroad, etc.), given for a term of years, designed to be cut off and presented for payment when the interest is due; an interest warrant.
Any interest payment made or due on a bond, debenture or similar (no longer by a physical coupon).
The letter sent to parliamentary candidates at the 1918 general election, endorsing them as official representatives of the coalition government.
A person's face.
To use coupons to a such extent that makes the user actively looking for coupons in magazines, online and whatever they can be found.
definitions.example: Jenna coupons and she goes through three magazines a day to find the coupons.

definitions.definition: Someone who plays a harp, especially a pedal harp.
To defeat completely; to rout.
To defeat the plans or hopes of; to frustrate; disconcert.
To embarrass greatly; to confuse; to perplex; to disconcert.
definitions.example: Don't worry. Your joke did not really discomfit me.

definitions.definition: Discomfited; overthrown.
Uranium that contains a reduced (depleted) amount of the fissile isotope U-235 compared to natural uranium; it is used in applications where radioactivity is not needed.

Any of a group of narrow-spectrum antibiotics obtained from Penicillium molds or synthesized; they have a beta-lactam structure; most are active against gram-positive bacteria and used in the treatment of various infections and diseases.
A lazy person.
Any small passerine bird of the family Paridae, which are found in the woods of the Northern Hemisphere and of Africa.
A game in which prizes are covered up and mixed together in a container, so that contestants can dip their hand into the container and randomly pull out a prize.
(by extension) A selection solely at random.
To hold back, to restrain (someone or something).
To show restraint; to hold oneself back.
To repress (a desire, emotion etc.); to check or curb.
(with preposition "from") To stop oneself from some action or interference; to abstain.
To abstain from (food or drink).
The chorus or burden of a song repeated at the end of each verse or stanza.
A much repeated comment, complaint, or saying.
(usually derogatory) Someone who objects to the building of an undesirable structure in their neighborhood, especially in public policy debate.
definitions.example: fiscally conservative green (as in money) nimbies (may object to the building of anything which may decrease preexisting property values)

definitions.definition: Not wanting to have to deal with unpleasant or distasteful things near them.
definitions.example: Their vote against measures to help refugees has been perceived by the socially conscious margin of society as a typically nimby attitude.

definitions.definition: Shopping from home in response to offers on television advertising or shopping channels.
The act or process of confiscating.
To take something away from (someone) and keep it away; to deny someone something.
To degrade (a clergyman) from office.
To bereave.
Subject to deprivation; poor.
Stop; pause; hesitation as to proceeding; suspense of decision or action; scruple.
To linger; to stay; to tarry
To delay; to pause; to suspend proceedings or judgment in view of a doubt or difficulty; to hesitate; to put off the determination or conclusion of an affair.
To scruple or object; to take exception; to oppose; to balk
definitions.example: I demur to that statement.

definitions.definition: To interpose a demurrer.
To suspend judgment concerning; to doubt of or hesitate about
To cause delay to; to put off

A thin, crisp Indian bread made from lentil flour, optionally spiced or flavoured in various ways and either grilled or deep-fried, which may be eaten on its own as a snack, with chutneys as a starter or as an accompaniment to a meal.
Containing sand or grit; consisting of grit; caused by grit; full of hard particles.
Spirited; resolute; unyielding.
Intense and starkly realistic; depicting harsh reality, especially violence.
In marine mammals such as whales, a wide flat limb, adapted for swimming.
A flat, wide, paddle-like rubber covering for the foot, used in swimming.
A flat lever in a pinball machine, triggered by the player to strike the ball and keep it in play.
A small flat used to support a larger one.
A type of ball bowled by a leg spin bowler, which spins backwards and skids off the pitch with a low bounce.
Television remote control, clicker.
The hand.
A kind of false tooth, usually temporary.
A kitchen spatula.
Someone who flips, in the sense of buying a house or other asset and selling it quickly for profit.
Someone who flips in any other sense, for example throwing a coin.
To lift one or both flippers out of the water and slap the surface of the water.
An optical instrument used for observing small objects.
Any instrument for imaging very small objects (such as an electron microscope).
To examine with a microscope, to put under a microscope (literally or figuratively).
Dawn.
A hair pomade, making the hair shine brilliantly.
A smooth shiny, luxurious fabric, often of alpaca or vicuña.
To apply brilliantine to the hair.
Any of several Old World birds of prey of the genus Buteo with broad wings and a broad tail.
Any scavenging bird such as the American black vulture (Coragyps atratus) or the turkey vulture (Cathartes aura).
(often preceded by "old", the "old buzzard") In North America, a curmudgeonly or cantankerous man; an old person; a mean, greedy person.
A blockhead; a dunce.
A score of two over par (for one hole)
A person engaged in the business of selling books.
A business that sells books.
A tropical tree, Tamarindus indica.
The fruit of this tree; the pulp is used as spice in Asian cooking and in Worcestershire sauce.
Other similar species:
(color) A dark brown colour, like that of tamarind pulp (also called tamarind brown).

(games) A radio or television programme that involves members of the public or celebrities, whether as individuals or as part of a team, playing a game, especially involving the answering of quiz questions, for cash or prizes.
To allow (something, often hair) to grow unimpeded.
A religious sacrifice.
An offering or concession made to an adversary in the hope of obtaining peace or reconciliation; an olive branch.
Tediously lengthy; dwelling on trivial details.
Long; having great length.
Marked by courage and determination in the face of difficulties or danger; having guts
Not showing due respect
A form of psychotherapy in which a patient acts a role in a context devised by a psychotherapist.
A drama in this form
A dramatic work focusing on the psychology of its characters
Containing sulfur.
Of, or relating to sulfur, especially in its lower oxidation state.

The highest grade of flag officer in the United States Navy, ranking above a four-star admiral and junior only to the Secretary of the Navy, Secretary of Defense, and the President of the United States; equal in grade or rank to a general of the army. Usually called admiral of the fleet in other navies.
A native or inhabitant of Alsace.
(dated US) A German shepherd dog.
A rogue or debauchee, like those who haunted Alsatia in London.
A working lunch at which important discussions may be held, and important decisions made.
A Middle Eastern salad or meze generally consisting of bulgur wheat, chopped tomatoes, parsley, olive oil and lemon juice.
Transportation by sea
To transport by sea
A country's entire sea force, including ships and personnel.
A governmental department in charge of a country's sea force.
A dark blue colour, usually called navy blue.
Having the dark blue colour of navy blue.
Belonging to the navy; typical of the navy.
Of, pertaining to, being, or resembling spam (junk e-mail).
An overcomplicated task, especially one perceived as a waste of time.
definitions.example: Adjusting this television is a bit of a faff.

definitions.definition: (typically in the phrase 'in a faff') A state of confused or frantic activity.
definitions.example: She's in a total faff about tonight's dinner party.

definitions.definition: To waste time on an unproductive activity.
definitions.example: I decided to stop faffing about and get some work done.

definitions.definition: A liquid to consume; a drink, such as tea, coffee, liquor, beer, milk, juice, or soft drinks, usually excluding water.
(A gift of) drink money.
A person who advocates an ideology, especially as an official or preeminent advocate.
To separate into two or more pieces, to fracture or crack, by a process that cannot easily be reversed for reassembly.
definitions.example: If the vase falls to the floor, it might break.

definitions.definition: To divide (something, often money) into smaller units.
definitions.example: Can you break a hundred-dollar bill for me?

definitions.definition: To cause (a person or animal) to lose spirit or will; to crush the spirits of.
definitions.example: Her child's death broke Angela.

definitions.definition: To be crushed, or overwhelmed with sorrow or grief.
definitions.example: My heart is breaking.

definitions.definition: To interrupt; to destroy the continuity of; to dissolve or terminate.
definitions.example: I had won four games in a row, but now you've broken my streak of luck.

definitions.definition: To ruin financially.
definitions.example: The recession broke some small businesses.

definitions.definition: To violate, to not adhere to.
definitions.example: He broke his vows by cheating on his wife.

definitions.definition: (of a fever) To pass the most dangerous part of the illness; to go down, in terms of temperature.
definitions.example: Susan's fever broke at about 3 AM, and the doctor said the worst was over.

definitions.definition: (of a spell of settled weather) To end.
definitions.example: The forecast says the hot weather will break by midweek.

definitions.definition: (of a storm) To begin; to end.
definitions.example: Around midday the storm broke, and the afternoon was calm and sunny.

definitions.definition: (of morning, dawn, day etc.) To arrive.
definitions.example: Morning has broken.

definitions.definition: To render (a game) unchallenging by altering its rules or exploiting loopholes or weaknesses in them in a way that gives a player an unfair advantage.
definitions.example: Changing the rules to let white have three extra queens would break chess.

definitions.definition: To stop, or to cause to stop, functioning properly or altogether.
definitions.example: Did you two break the trolley by racing with it?

definitions.definition: To cause (a barrier) to no longer bar.
definitions.example: break a seal

definitions.definition: To destroy the arrangement of; to throw into disorder; to pierce.
definitions.example: The cavalry were not able to break the British squares.

definitions.definition: (of a wave of water) To collapse into surf, after arriving in shallow water.
To burst forth; to make its way; to come into view.
To interrupt or cease one's work or occupation temporarily.
definitions.example: Let's break for lunch.

definitions.definition: To interrupt (a fall) by inserting something so that the falling object does not (immediately) hit something else beneath.
definitions.example: He survived the jump out the window because the bushes below broke his fall.

definitions.definition: To disclose or make known an item of news, etc.
definitions.example: I don't know how to break this to you, but your cat is not coming back.

definitions.definition: (of a sound) To become audible suddenly.
To change a steady state abruptly.
definitions.example: His coughing broke the silence.

definitions.definition: To suddenly become.
definitions.example: The arrest was standard, when suddenly the suspect broke ugly.

definitions.definition: Of a male voice, to become deeper at puberty.
Of a voice, to alter in type due to emotion or strain: in men generally to go up, in women sometimes to go down; to crack.
definitions.example: His voice breaks when he gets emotional.

definitions.definition: To surpass or do better than (a specific number), to do better than (a record), setting a new record.
definitions.example: He broke the men's 100-meter record.

definitions.definition: (most often in the passive tense) To demote, to reduce the military rank of.
To end (a connection), to disconnect.
definitions.example: I couldn't hear a thing he was saying, so I broke the connection and called him back.

definitions.definition: (of an emulsion) To demulsify.
To counter-attack
To lay open, as a purpose; to disclose, divulge, or communicate.
To become weakened in constitution or faculties; to lose health or strength.
To fail in business; to become bankrupt.
To destroy the strength, firmness, or consistency of.
definitions.example: to break flax

definitions.definition: To destroy the official character and standing of; to cashier; to dismiss.
To make an abrupt or sudden change; to change the gait.
definitions.example: to break into a run or gallop

definitions.definition: To fall out; to terminate friendship.
To terminate the execution of a program before normal completion.
To suspend the execution of a program during debugging so that the state of the program can be investigated.
Financially ruined, bankrupt.
Without any money, penniless.
definitions.example: dead broke; flat broke

definitions.definition: Broken.
definitions.example: If it ain't broke, don't fix it.

definitions.definition: Demoted, deprived of a commission.
definitions.example: He was broke and rendered unfit to serve His Majesty at sea.

definitions.definition: (papermaking) Paper or board that is discarded and repulped during the manufacturing process.
A fragment, remains, a piece broken off.
To act as a broker; to transact business for another.
To act as procurer in love matters; to pimp.
Broke off, rich, wealthy
Evergreen shrub, of the genus Ulex, having spiny leaves and yellow flowers.
A piping or whistling sound caused by difficult respiration.
An ordinary whisper exaggerated so as to produce the hoarse sound known as the "stage whisper"; a forcible whisper with some admixture of tone.
(British, Irish) An ulterior scheme or plan
Something very humorous or laughable.
definitions.example: The new comedy is a wheeze.

definitions.definition: To breathe hard, and with an audible piping or whistling sound, as persons affected with asthma.
A large, semi-aquatic, herbivorous (plant-eating) African mammal (Hippopotamus amphibius)
Without love.
definitions.example: Theirs was a loveless marriage: they stayed together even though they didn't care for each other.

definitions.definition: A person who, as a profession, profits from large financial transactions.
A company that does the same.
One charged with the administration of finance; an officer who administers the public revenue; a treasurer.
A light, spongy teacake, usually based on almond flour or flavoring.

A traditional French (Ragoût a la Financière) or Piemontese (Finanziera alla piemontese) rich sauce or ragout, made with coxcomb, wattles, cock's testicles, chicken livers and a variety of other ingredients.
To carry out financial transactions; to finance something.
Relating to, or supported by two groups, especially by two political parties
